intro: Pennellia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered pennellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. Pennellia micrantha is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native range.
